revised_title: Awards and Achievements in Science: Royal Society Anniversary Address 1984
tldr: The President of the Royal Society, Sir Andrew Huxley, delivers the Anniversary Address highlighting the achievements and contributions of various scientists in different fields. The address mentions the recipients of the Royal Society's prestigious awards, including the Copley Medal, Rumford Medal, Royal Medal, Davy Medal, Darwin Medal, Hughes Medal, Leverhulme Medal, Mullard Medal, Royal Society Esso Award, and the Royal Society Welcome Foundation Prize. The address also touches upon the financial support of research in universities and the government's plans to improve funding.
